amber عَنْبَر 𐭠𐭭𐭡𐭫 /ambar/ “ambergris” ענבר ʻinbar •μπάρι κεχριμπάρι kechrimpári

µpyro burn Bernstein буршты́н burštýn

𓄿 𓅓 𓊮 | burn, burn up | amburn amber

why is amber (burning stone) so consistently mixed up with electrum (shining stone) ?

𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 | amber |
𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 𓋞 𓈒 𓏥 | ambergris | -gris χρυσ 𓋞
𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 𓋞 𓈒 𓏥 | electrum | el κεχριμπάρι kechrimpári إلكتروم al quatrum elektrum
𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 𓋞 𓈒 𓏥 | electrum | 𓋞 κεχρι 𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 μπάρι amber-gris : χρυσ 𓋞
𓈞 𓃀 𓊌 | a mineral (not metal) | •amber um.bir.𓊌 μπάρι

琥珀金 hupo {jin} amber/electrum 호박금 hobakgeum ≠ soma

κεχριμπάρι kechrimpári !> 𐭪𐭤𐭫𐭯𐭠𐭣 khłpʾd kah-rubāy™ کهربا kahrobâ ⇔ nectar

𓋞 amber ⚠️ 𒅎𒁀𒊒 im-ba-ru •µbaruⁿ nubrina nebula *nébʰos *néba *nábʰas νεφέλη nephélē “cloud, mist”

𓌀 𓅓 al.ecḏꜥm = electrum 𓌁 𓅓 𓋞 𓈒 𓏥 !
𓌀 𓏏 𓈈 ἑκατόμ ( Θῆβαι ἑκατόμπυλοι Thēbai hekatómpyloi 100-gates )
𓌀 𓏏 𓏥 sceptres

electrum al.lectrum amber ( al.leucht supported by alloy alluminium vs alligō (bind⚡︎) )

𓌀 𓅓 electrum ἤλεκτρον ⇔
𓌁 electricity (pictural ++)
𓌁 ḏꜥm ⇔ Strom

𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 𓋞 𓈒 𓏥 | electrum| > alloy of gold and silver,
𓌁 𓅓 𓅱 𓋞 𓈒 𓏥 | fine gold, electrum|κεχριμπάρι kechrimpári ⇔ კარგი ḳargi (fine) хоро́ший xoróšij
𓌁 𓅓 𓏲 𓋞 | fine gold, electrum|al-ectrum? 𓌁𓅓 ⇔ εκλεκτός eklektós extra-fine
𓌁 𓋞 𓇱 | fine gold, electrum| ἤλεκτρον ḗlektron ⇔ (doubtful) उल्का ulka, “meteor” ἠλέκτωρ ēléktōr, “shining sun” ἥλιος

𓅓 𓆑 𓂓 𓏏 𓈓 | turquoise | amber.zn.ca.it piruz فیروزه … փիրուզ फीरोज़ा … wanderword@Avestan paitiraōcah +++-
𓅓 𓆑 𓎡 𓏏 𓈓 | turquoise | muskat! модруљ

𓆊 𓆌 𓆋 𓆎 alligator el lagarto “the lizard” lacertus “lizard” influenced by unrelated alligator “one who binds”

κεχριμπάρι = nectar νέκταρ néktar, “nourishment of the gods” *neḱ- “perish, disappear” + *-tr̥h₂ “overcoming” through
nectar янта́р jantár Lithuanian jentaras, gẽntaras, literary giñtaras, gintãras Latvian dzintars > ента́рь entárʹ “amber”

𓋴 𓆑 𓏏 𓏊 | resin | ⲥⲟⲛϯ tar-sand?

amber replaced eolhsand “amber”, smelting “amber”, Old English glær “amber” glare?, and Old English
sāp “amber, resin, pomade” սաթ satʿ ⇔ stone

https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/amber#Translations
